entry.p: Not long ago I ran across a wonderful quote from Frédéric Chopin:
entry.blockquote: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.
entry.p: Ironically, I tend to associate Chopin's music with "a vast quantity of notes"; to find simplicity, I would seek out, say, the music of Erik Satie, whose Trois Gymnopédies I've been re-learning on guitar of late.
Or, as is written in chapter 56 of the Tao Te Ching:
entry.blockquote:
Those who know don't say
Those who say don't know
entry.p: And, of course, Thoreau, who urged us to "Simplify, simplify."
Contemplating the matter makes me want to contemplate more and write less...

ul.li: Tao Te Ching §56: One with the Way (2023-08-26)
